Section.name: S_2663
Section.title: PATHOLOGIC STAGE CLASSIFICATION (pTNM, AJCC 8th Edition) (Note I)

DisplayedItem.name: DI_39806
DisplayedItem.title: Note: Reporting of pT, pN, and (when applicable) pM categories is based on information available to the pathologist at the time the report is issued. As per the AJCC (Chapter 1, 8th Ed.) it is the managing physician’s responsibility to establish the final pathologic stage based upon all pertinent information, including but potentially not limited to this pathology report.

Property.name: p_rptTxt_39806_1
Property.val: Note: Reporting of pT, pN, and (when applicable) pM categories is based on information available to the pathologist at the time the report is issued. As per the AJCC (Chapter 1, 8th Ed.) it is the managing physician’s responsibility to establish the final pathologic stage based upon all pertinent information, including but potentially not limited to this pathology report.

ListItem.name: LI_37690
ListItem.title: pTX: Primary tumor cannot be assessed

ListItem.name: LI_37691
ListItem.title: pT0: No evidence of primary tumor

ListItem.name: LI_37692
ListItem.title: pTis: Carcinoma in situ (intramucosal carcinoma; invasion of the lamina propria or extension into but not through the muscularis mucosae)

ListItem.name: LI_37693
ListItem.title: pTis (LAMN): Low-grade appendiceal mucinous neoplasm confined by the muscularis propria. Acellular mucin or mucinous epithelium may invade into the muscularis propria. (T1 and T2 are not applicable to LAMN. Acellular mucin or mucinous epithelium that extends into the subserosa or serosa should be classified as T3 or T4a, respectively.)

ListItem.name: LI_37694
ListItem.title: pT1: Tumor invades the submucosa (through the muscularis mucosa but not into the muscularis propria)

ListItem.name: LI_37695
ListItem.title: pT2: Tumor invades the muscularis propria

ListItem.name: LI_37696
ListItem.title: pT3: Tumor invades through the muscularis propria into the subserosa or the mesoappendix

DisplayedItem.name: DI_52419
DisplayedItem.title: pT4: Tumor invades the visceral peritoneum, including the acellular mucin or mucinous epithelium involving the serosa of the appendix or mesoappendix, and / or directly invades adjacent organs or structures

ListItem.name: LI_37698
ListItem.title: pT4a: Tumor invades through the visceral peritoneum, including the acellular mucin or mucinous epithelium involving the serosa of the appendix or serosa of the mesoappendix

DisplayedItem.name: DI_41398
DisplayedItem.title: # The text in parentheses is not applicable to pT determination. A tumor grossly adherent to other organs or structures is classified as cT4b; however, if no tumor is identified on pathological examination of the adhesion, the T category assigned based on the depth of wall invasion observed on microscopic examination (typically pT1-3).

ListItem.name: LI_37699
ListItem.title: pT4b: Tumor directly invades (or adheres to#) adjacent organs or structures

ListItem.name: LI_37701
ListItem.title: pNX: Regional lymph nodes cannot be assessed

ListItem.name: LI_37702
ListItem.title: pN0: No regional lymph node metastasis

DisplayedItem.name: DI_51872
DisplayedItem.title: pN1: One to three regional lymph nodes are positive (tumor in lymph node measuring >= 0.2 mm) or any number of tumor deposits is present, and all identifiable lymph nodes are negative

ListItem.name: LI_37704
ListItem.title: pN1a: One regional lymph node is positive

ListItem.name: LI_37705
ListItem.title: pN1b: Two or three regional lymph nodes are positive

ListItem.name: LI_37706
ListItem.title: pN1c: No regional lymph nodes are positive, but there are tumor deposits in the subserosa or mesentery

ListItem.name: LI_37707
ListItem.title: pN2: Four or more regional lymph nodes are positive

DisplayedItem.name: DI_37061
DisplayedItem.title: Note: For specimens containing acellular mucin without identifiable tumor cells, efforts should be made to obtain additional tissue for thorough histologic examination to evaluate for cellularity.

ListItem.name: LI_37709
ListItem.title: ?Not applicable - pM cannot be determined from the submitted specimen(s)

Property.name: p_rptTxt_37709_1
Property.val: Not applicable - pM cannot be determined from the submitted specimen(s)

ListItem.name: LI_37711
ListItem.title: pM1a: Intraperitoneal acellular mucin, without identifiable tumor cells in the disseminated peritoneal mucinous deposits

ListItem.name: LI_37712
ListItem.title: pM1b: Intraperitoneal metastasis only, including peritoneal mucinous deposits containing tumor cells

ListItem.name: LI_37680
ListItem.title: pM1c: Metastasis to sites other than peritoneum
